summary:
KEYWORDS:
Automotive ● Vehicle Dynamics  ●  Powertrains ● Simulation ● Modelling ● Control ● Project Management  ● Programming (C, Matlab, Modelica, Java) ● Model Based Systems Engineering  ●  CAD/FEM (NX)

ABOUT ME:
•	BSc in Mechanical Engineering (2:1)
•	MSc Student Automotive Technology

ACADEMIC HIGHLIGHTS
•	Selection of Control, Powertrain and Vehicle Dynamics courses, all completed with an A or higher. 
•	BSc thesis in testing and validation of custom electric motors

OTHER:
•	Experience with simulation models in automotive application. These include but are not limited to:   driveline, two track, bicycle, quarter car, brush tyre and Delft tyre models. 
•	Experience with MATLAB, including teaching MATLAB to new master students at TU/e.
•	Experience with team management in Formula Student.
•	Experience with (high-voltage) electric powertrains, completed course on working on high-voltage powertrains in Formula Student by Dekra (see picture).
•	Experience with different programming languages and methods.

treasury_media.title: Simulation of eigenmodes for my Bachelor thesis
treasury_media.description: The motors I used for my Bachelor thesis could run up to 18,000 RPM. This simulation proves that the setup that the motors will be mounted on will not resonate on a frequency range of the electric motors.

treasury_media.title: Course on working with High-Voltage powertrains

awards.title: 1st Place for course 4AT100. Best design for an electric supercharger.
awards.description:
For the course 4AT100, an electric supercharger (eSupercharger) is designed. First a market research is done and a target audience selected. Using the model-based systems engineering approach and the Theory of Inventive Problem Solving (TRIZ), the team came up with an innovatively designed eSupercharger driven by a switched reluctance motor (SRM) which has an integrated compressor by making double winded rotor slots for the SRM. To end different specifications for eSuperchargers such that they can be fitted on a range of engines a Quasi Static model was created. The eSupercharger designed proved to have a big advantage for a 0-100 km/h acceleration.
The university found our approach the most scientific and most innovative.

awards.title: 1st Place "Acceleration" at Formula Student Spain 2013
awards.description:
Winner of the acceleration event at the Formula Student Spain 2013 Event.

The acceleration event tests the car's performance on a straight line. The acceleration is performed from a standing start on a straight of 75m. The winning time was 3.766 seconds which corresponds with a 0-100 km/h time of 2.8 seconds.

Competing in the electric class of the 2013 Formula Student Spain competition are 16 teams originating from four different countries around Europe.

awards.title: 1st Place "Overall Statics" at Formula Student Spain 2013
awards.description:
Winner of the Overall Statics Award at the Formula Student Spain 2013 Event.

The Overall Statics Award combines the results of all the static events during the 2013 Formula Student Spain competition.

These static events are:

- Engineering Design Event
- Cost Report
- Business Presentation

Competing the 2013 Formula Student Spain competition are 32 teams originating from 6 different countries around the world

awards.title: 1st Place "Skidpad" Formula Student Electric
awards.description:
Winner of the skidpad event at the Formula Student Electric 2012 Event.

In the skidpad event the car is being tested on cornering performance on a wet surface.

Competing in the Formula Student Electric competition 2012 are 32 teams originating from 8 different countries around Europe.

profile_positions.location: Son en Breugel, North Brabant, Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Designer

profile_positions.description: Improving modeling and calibration efforts in hybrid DCT application. Investigating possibilities to implement machine learning in new simulation models and applications.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Intern

profile_positions.description:
Activities included:
• Support with development of simulation models for the 'Engineering Energy and Weight Management Complete Vehicle' department.
• Assist with further development for continuous and efficient workflow processes. A workflow that creates a simulation model from requirements to results. This requires a modular simulation model that can be created and run in a single environment.
• Assist with analysis and testing of possible solutions and simulation tools which can be used to support these processes.
• Analysis of numerical aspects of these modular simulation models with test models and scenarios
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
Training new Master students how to use MATLAB. This course is part of the homologation module offered to Automotive Technology, Sustainable Energy and Systems and Control  master programs. Goal for this homologation part is to ensure new students don't lose any time during their studies learning the MATLAB interface and are introduced to programming inside MATLAB/Simulink.  

Activities included:
• Teaching students how to use MATLAB/Simulink.
• Creating course material.
• Helping students during the guided self-study for this program.
• Examination and grading of students.
profile_positions.title: MATLAB Trainer

profile_positions.description:
Advising current board on powertrain. Responsible for motor testing and validation. Also responsible for new software structure for the URE10, the 1st all-wheel driven electric race car of University Racing Eindhoven.

Developed new software structure to be used in electronic control unit. Implemented libraries to use for messages from/to the control unit and integrating control software into the electronic control unit.
profile_positions.title: Powertrain Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Head of the Powertrain department in the URE team. Setting goals and a concept for the electronics of the URE08, the 4th electric race car of University Racing Eindhoven. 

This department consists of around 10 students designing, building and testing the powertrain for a Formula Student Electric vehicle. The group was responsible for the accumulator, motor-controller, motor and driveline.

The focus for the URE08 was to reduce the weight compared to the previous car, the URE07. Ultimately 40 kilograms were saved compared to the URE07 which resulted of a car of 205 kilograms.
profile_positions.title: Powertrain Manager

profile_positions.description:
Since testing and validation of a vehicle is a vital part within the Formula Student competition, a special department within University Racing Eindhoven is dedicated towards planning, organisation and technical issues that might occur during testing days.

Within this team my responsibilities lie within running the current and previous car, running checklists and making sure the car suffers no technical issues.

Activities include:
• Responsible for running the current car and the car from the previous season.
• Mechanical and electrical setting up the car as defined in the test plan.
• Defining track layout's which can be used. 
• Driver training and studying racing lines and behaviour.
• Car performance and setup and correlation with (tyre) models

During this period I gained a lot of knowledge regarding (race-)car setup and electric powertrains. Also getting familiar with the simulation models used by the team. I learned a great deal regarding vehicle dynamics and simulation models. These include different tyre models like the delft tyre model and the brush model. Highlights for me were during the Michelin Green X Student Days where we had to test the car surrounded with fellow engineering students and experts and winning the skid-pad event in the Formula Student Germany competition.
profile_positions.title: Test Team (Performance) Engineer and Mechanic

profile_positions.description:
Helping out in the warehouse.

Actvities include:
• Setting up new system for distribution of tools and parts.
• Taking orders for parts from personnel.
• Bring high-priority parts to work sites.
• Monitor stock of frequently used parts.
• Tidying up warehouse.
profile_positions.title: Warehouse Assistant
